Instrument_Host_PDS3.instrument_host_desc:
The ground-based observations for the GEM project were supplied by groups using two supporting astronomical observatories. Listed below are the separate telescopes with appropriate observational parameters for which data was submitted.
Calar Alto Telescopes -----------------------------------------------------------------------
3.5m
Prime focus with 2 lens corrector: f/3.5, focal length = 12.195 m 1 arc sec = 59 micron, 1 mm = 16.9 arc sec , FOV: 28.2 arcmin = 100 mm CCD scales for imaging: TEK 24 micron = 0.41 arc sec -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2.2m
RC (Cassegrain) focus: f/8, focal length = 17.610 m 1 arc sec = 85.4 micron, 1 mm = 11.7 arc sec , FOV (w/o corrector lens): 33 arcmin = 170 mm FOV (with corrector lens): 67 arcmin = 345 mm CCD scales for imaging: RCA 15 micron = 0.176 arc sec TEK 24 micron = 0.28 arc sec -----------------------------------------------------------------------
1.23m
RC (Cassegrain) focus: f/8, focal length = 9.857 m 1 arc sec = 47.8 micron, 1 mm = 20.9 arc sec FOV (w/o corrector lens): 15 arcmin = 43 mm FOV (with corrector lens): 90 arcmin = 258 mm -----------------------------------------------------------------------
ESO telescopes
2.2 m
RC(Cassegrain) focus: f/8, focal length = 17.610 m in conjunction with the EFOSC2 (focal reducer) makes the plate scale 19.05 arc sec/mm
(Grism 1 with a wavelength range of 340-920 nm and a resolution of 0.84 nm/pixel was used.)
These descriptions were available via the World Wide Web interface for each observatory and are current for 1995.
